#customsight #sight #arl44 #arl_44 #semi_historical #fictional

This package contains two sights for the French ARL-44 tank destroyer. Contrary to the other sight package I already published for the ARL-44, this sight is much finer and clearer in the center making long-distance engagements much easier.

The first sight (SBF_arl44_grill_500.blk) I consider "semi-historical", as it is patterned after french light tank sights of post-WW2 era. This sight features the "grill-like" ballistics and mils graduation as we see in a similar form for US WW2 hardw

Schindibee's Sight for M4A3 (105) HVSS Sherman

#customsight #sight #sherman #m4a3_105 #semifictional

This package contains sights for the 105mm howitzer armed M4A3 Sherman.

The sight features primary aiming scale, ranging funnel (for tank length of 7m / width of 3.5m) and deflection aiming cues (for moving targets, 20km/ and 40km/h) for the HEAT ammo, secondary aiming scales for HE and Smoke ammo and coaxial machine gun.

The sight also features a pattern as historically used by the US Army in WW2, with horizontal MILS scale (gap and line length 5 mils each).

#m42 #m42duster #duster #40mm_bofors gunsight.

Modification of Sick2day's JSDF speed ring. Slightly thicker lines and smaller circles for a more visible sight. The inner circle now matches a range of 1200m for ground targets. While the second and third circle have a good aiming indication for aircraft flying straight. (this was tweaked at the A20G-25 in the JP testrange.)

Works for both the US and JP M42 (and all other 40mm Bofors, but other vehicles may not have used this particular sight version)

Gunner view specifically made for the American M103 heavy tank. This sight is purely aesthetic and not historical whatsoever. I removed the horizontal range adjustment lines and have placed more emphasis on firing at medium to long ranges, as I believe the tank excels in such combat. I included the armor values of the tank in a turret/hull format, as well as the performance card of the stock AP round (the HEAT is expensive and its performance is much easier to remember).

For SB, I have included a single line pointing to where the gun is in relation to the gunner's view. May Eisenhower guide
